source.query: one arm dumbbell row muscles worked
source.raw_text:
The One-Arm Dumbbell Row is a horizontal pulling exercise targeting the Latissimus Dorsi (lats) as the primary mover, supported by the Rhomboids, Traps, and Posterior Deltoids for scapular retraction and shoulder extension, with the Biceps, Forearms (for grip), and Core (for stability) acting as secondary muscles. The movement pattern involves hinging at the hips, keeping your back flat, and pulling the dumbbell towards your hip/abdomen by retracting the shoulder blade and flexing the elbow, emphasizing controlled shoulder extension and adduction. [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]  
Muscles Worked: 

• Primary: 

    • Latissimus Dorsi (Lats): The main muscle, responsible for pulling the arm down and back (shoulder extension/adduction). 

• Secondary/Synergistic: 

    • Rhomboids (Major & Minor): Pull shoulder blades together (retraction). 
    • Trapezius (Middle & Lower Fibers): Stabilize and retract the scapula. 
    • Posterior Deltoids (Rear Delts): Assist in shoulder extension/horizontal abduction. 
    • Biceps Brachii & Brachialis: Flex the elbow to bring the weight up. 
    • Forearm Muscles (Brachioradialis, etc.): Maintain grip. 
    • Core Muscles (Abs, Obliques): Stabilize the torso and prevent twisting. [2, 3, 5, 7, 8]  

Movement Pattern: 

1. Setup: Place one knee and hand on a bench, keeping your back flat and torso roughly parallel to the floor. 
2. Stretch/Reach: Let the dumbbell hang, allowing your shoulder to stretch forward (shoulder flexion/protraction). 
3. Pull/Concentric: Pull the dumbbell up towards your hip/abdomen by driving your elbow back and squeezing your shoulder blade towards your spine (shoulder extension/adduction, scapular retraction). 
4. Peak Contraction: Squeeze at the top, feeling the back muscles engage. 
5. Lower/Eccentric: Slowly lower the weight back to the starting stretched position with control, resisting the weight. 
6. Key: Avoid torso rotation; focus on pulling with your back muscles, not just your arms. [1, 4, 6, 9]  

**Citations:**

[1] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tLnlWj7LQ34
[2] https://nielasher.com/es/blogs/strength-and-conditioning/single-arm-dumbbell-row
[3] https://nfpt.com/proper-form-for-a-one-arm-dumbbell-row/
[4] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jHMkcYbECkA
[5] https://nielasher.com/blogs/strength-and-conditioning/single-arm-dumbbell-row
[6] https://www.muscleandstrength.com/exercises/one-arm-dumbbell-row.html
[7] https://learn.athleanx.com/articles/back-for-men/how-to-do-dumbbell-rows
[8] https://www.oreateai.com/blog/singlearm-dumbbell-row-training-guide-muscle-activation-and-movement-standards-explained/94d278012bf77682d6c62862844d917b
[9] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sUqz6oaISkQ
